title: Toilet Facilities
moduleName: Module 4: Harvest Crew - Harvest Worker Hygiene
description: Establishes requirements for adequate, properly located, designed, maintained, supplied, and serviced toilet facilities for harvest crew operations

requirements.text: Are toilet facilities adequate in number and location? A ZERO POINT (NON-COMPLIANCE) DOWN SCORE IN THIS QUESTION RESULTS IN AUTOMATIC FAILURE OF THIS AUDIT.
mandatoryStatements: Toilet facilities are provided in adequate numbers based on worker population
Facilities meet or exceed regulatory requirements for worker-to-toilet ratios
Toilet locations provide reasonable access to all harvest areas
Facilities are strategically placed to encourage use and discourage field contamination
Additional facilities are provided as crew size increases
Facility placement considers distance and travel time for workers
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily verification of adequate facilities for current crew size, quarterly review of facility adequacy as operations change
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily count of operational toilet facilities and comparison to crew size, immediate action if facilities become inadequate

requirements.text: Are toilet facilities located where they are not a risk of contamination to product, packaging, equipment, water sources and growing areas?
mandatoryStatements: Toilet facilities are positioned away from harvest areas
Facilities are located to prevent contamination of product contact surfaces
Placement prevents contamination risk to packaging materials
Facilities are positioned away from equipment storage and use areas
Toilets are located away from water sources (wells, irrigation water, wash water)
Facility placement considers prevailing winds and drainage patterns
Minimum setback distances from sensitive areas are maintained
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual evaluation of toilet placement relative to operational areas, immediate assessment if operational areas change
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily verification that no contamination pathways exist from toilets to product or production areas

requirements.text: Are toilet facilities designed and maintained to prevent contamination (e.g., free from leaks and cracks)?
mandatoryStatements: Toilet facilities are designed with proper containment systems
Facilities are regularly inspected for leaks and structural damage
Cracks, holes, or damage are repaired promptly
Waste containment systems function properly without leaks
Facility design prevents waste overflow or spillage
Maintenance records document repairs and preventive maintenance
requirements.verificationExpectations: Weekly inspection of facility integrity and containment systems, monthly review of maintenance records
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily inspection for visible leaks or damage, immediate repair of any containment failures

requirements.text: Are toilet facilities constructed of materials that are easy to clean?
mandatoryStatements: Toilet facilities are constructed of smooth, non-porous materials
Interior surfaces are designed for easy cleaning and sanitizing
Materials resist bacterial growth and moisture damage
Construction allows effective cleaning of all surfaces
Materials withstand repeated cleaning and sanitizing
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual evaluation of facility materials and cleanability, assessment during facility repairs or upgrades
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily verification that facilities can be effectively cleaned

requirements.text: Are toilet facilities supplied with toilet paper and is the toilet paper maintained properly (e.g., toilet paper rolls are not stored on the floor or in the urinals)?
mandatoryStatements: Toilet paper is provided in all toilet facilities
Adequate supply is maintained at all times
Toilet paper is stored in sanitary manner off the floor
Dispensers or holders protect toilet paper from contamination
Extra rolls are stored properly, not in unsanitary locations
Regular checks ensure continuous availability
requirements.verificationExpectations: Weekly verification of supply adequacy and storage practices
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily inspection of toilet paper availability and proper storage, immediate restocking when low

requirements.text: Where used, is there a documented procedure for emptying the waste holding tanks in a hygienic manner and also in a way that prevents product, packaging, equipment, water systems and growing area contamination?
mandatoryStatements: Documented procedure exists for waste tank emptying
Procedure specifies frequency of emptying based on usage
Hygienic practices for waste handling are defined
Procedure prevents contamination to product and production areas
Emptying occurs away from harvest operations
Equipment used for waste handling is dedicated and identified
Personnel performing waste handling are trained
Records document date, time, and person responsible for waste disposal
requirements.verificationExpectations: Monthly review of waste disposal records, quarterly audit of procedure compliance
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Verification that waste disposal follows documented procedure, immediate investigation if contamination risk identified

requirements.text: Are the toilet facilities and hand washing stations clean and are there records showing cleaning, servicing and stocking is occurring regularly?
mandatoryStatements: Toilet facilities and handwashing stations are visibly clean
Cleaning schedule is established and followed
Cleaning frequency is adequate for usage levels
Records document date, time, and person who performed cleaning
Servicing of facilities is documented (waste removal, repairs)
Stocking of supplies (soap, paper towels, toilet paper) is recorded
Records demonstrate consistent, regular maintenance
Deficiencies are documented and corrected promptly
requirements.verificationExpectations: Weekly review of cleaning and maintenance records for completeness and frequency, quarterly audit of actual facility conditions versus records
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily verification of facility cleanliness and supply stocking, immediate cleaning if unsanitary conditions observed

capaInject: If toilet facilities inadequate: immediately provide additional facilities or reduce crew size, achieve compliance before continuing operations
If toilet facilities pose contamination risk: immediately relocate or modify, complete risk assessment before restart
If toilet facility structural failures: immediate repair, provide alternative facilities until repaired
If waste disposal procedures not followed: immediate retraining, investigate contamination risk, implement additional controls
traceabilityInject: Toilet facility cleaning and maintenance records must be traceable to dates, persons, and facilities serviced
Waste disposal records must be traceable to specific dates, personnel, and disposal locations
